snippet.title: Marvel Vs. Capcom 2 playthrough (Dreamcast)
snippet.description:
60fps available!

Playthrough with Ken, Sentinel and Captain Commando. MvC 2 was the first game in the series not to use the CPS hardware, instead, it uses Naomi. Without the CPS memory restrictions to hold them back, Capcom were able to include just about every character from the previous games in the series, along with adding several new characters (such as Cable and Son-Son) and some extra characters taken from other Capcom games (eg Guile and Anakaris).

Matches are now 3 against 3 rather than 2 against 2, and the controls have been changed so there are four attack buttons and two assist buttons -the assist buttons have one of your other characters come on and perform an attack or technique, and each character has a choice of 3 assist moves you can choose from at the character select screen.

New game features include "snap backs", which let you force your opponent off the screen for a brief amount of time at the cost of a hyper combo guage. Delayed hyper combos let you call each member of your team on, one at a time, to perform a long hyper combo consisting of moves from each of your characters.

The Dreamcast version of the game is still seen as the best one. This is a playthrough of the Japanese version, not that it really matters as there are no win quotes and there is only one ending, which doesn't have any text in it.
